reviews.text: On Aug. 30th after arriving at another establishment in Valemount B.C. at 8:30pm to find that my reservation had not been booked on the proper date. I was left with no room.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and reasonably priced

reviews.text: I ended up staying at the Ramada and found out that my misfortune had been a blessing in disquise.
reviews.title: Not Ramada star quality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luckily the Ramada had a cancellation and after hearing my plight offered me the room and matched the price of the other place. The room was very nice, clean, updated, confortable and quiet. The staff that I dealt with were very curteous and had excellent customer service skills. The Ramada offered a Continental Breakfast which to my surprise was better than any hotel/motel I have stayed at in the past.
reviews.title: Not a good experience!

reviews.text: On my way back from my trip I stayed at the Ramada again and had the same excellent service.
reviews.title: Very basic

reviews.text: I would highly recommend anyone to stay at The Ramada in Valemount B.C.
reviews.title: A hidden GEM tucked away in the middle of the Rocky Mountains

reviews.text: Valemount is a half way point on our drive to Grande Prairie, Alberta. We were advised to stay at the Best Western (as it is the newest hotel there) but we were reluctant to spend $200 on a room for the night. We booked the Ramada as it is pet friendly and the cost, taxes in, was $132...still steep for an overnight but we found most hotels were around this price on our route.
reviews.title: Road Trip: Overnight Stay

reviews.text: The hotel room was renovated to include granite counter tops and new bedding and tile therefore the rooms look much newer than the rest of the hotel. No complaints on anything except for the bed. We felt like we were sleeping on an air mattress.
reviews.title: Won't be back

reviews.text: Our stay included a continental breakfast. The breakfast was surprisingly good as well as the service. They only had one staff member working the room and she managed to keep it clean and tidy even during the rush.
reviews.title: Perfect stay for me and two kids.

reviews.text: Overall, I would say if you are just passing through this is a great hotel for the price.
reviews.title: Blessing in Disguise

reviews.text: Carpet in our room was filthy, overpriced for what our room was, needs proper
reviews.title: Nice try but needs to do better

reviews.text: The rooms were okay looking but the bathroom stunk. The shower curtain was moldy, needs to be replaced. The A/C was so noisey from vibrations that it was hard to sleep. The pool was so cold that my kids would not even go in it. The roof had large cracks in the drywall, I thought it may fall down, I kept my kids away from that area. The continental breakfast okay and the service staff were very pleasant.
reviews.title: Cheap Prices But Poor Rooms

reviews.text: I know what to expect when I go to a highway Ramada property, but this one fell short on a number of fronts. I couldn't call out using the room phone and since my cell phone provider doesn't cover Valemount (Rogers!) I was really stuck. When I was able to get someone to call me the quality of the line was awful (crackling/static). Many of the TV channels including TSN were barely visible because they were so blurry. The sink water in the room took hours to drain. There's a nice big TV in the very small fitness centre but the tredmill is pointed so your back is to the TV (couldn't figure that one out!). They say the pool is open at 9:00 a.m. but they weren't in any hurry to open it (I don't think they want anyone to use it). Internet was incredibly slow - soooo frustrating. On the upside the service was pleasant, I had no issues with setting up the internet and sending email from Outlook, the rooms had many new fixtures like granite desk and sink top and the mattress was alright.
reviews.title: Lots of small things going wrong here

reviews.text: We booked the kitchenette unit which was $85/night through this site...the regular rate was $125.00
reviews.title: Quiet Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were new and really comfortable...the room was large but very poorly laid out. There was a stove, Fridge and microwave...but no table to eat at....one kitchen type chair which was broken but we were able to make it work at a counter for our 2 year old to eat at...there were two larger chairs but not even a coffee or end table. There also was no closet or hangers...we just kept the luggage dolly to drape our clothes on as we were attending a wedding....Oh and the plumbing under the kitchen sink is very loose...big flood of dishwater....can be easily fixed...lol
reviews.title: OK but Overpriced

reviews.text: this room was at the back, and it was virtually noise free....lots of pillows and a balcony. The front desk young man was pleasant, but perhaps new at his job...not to eager to help with the eating arrangements or the broken plumbing....maybe the renos I think are still ongoing...so I would probably try this hotel again because the beds were really great....
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on july 18 and 19th. my 4 year and 7 year old kids absolutly loved pool and waterslide. huge breakfast selections. hotel had no vacancy sign on, there was no disturbance and we had very quite sleep - either the building structure was good or all the guests were quite. will definatly be back
reviews.title: Awesome Stay

reviews.text: stayed here on our way though the Rockey Mountains. Hotel was located just off the highway so was very easy to find. Staff was good and rooms were unbelievable (stayed in room 131) they were VERY spacious and this one also had a jacuzzi in the room with 2 huge king beds. My kids loved the pool and water slide area and fitness center wasn't too bad either. I was really impressive with the breakfast area and the selection was big and the setup was done real nice compared to some other place we strayed at on this trip.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable beds, great find over all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thereis no premium satellite channels as said on advertisement, the rooms smell strange and the bathroom tub wouldnt drain cuz the plug kept fallin back down so when u shower all the water collects and u have to hold the plug up to drain the tub so your partner can shower next. u can hear your neighbours like they r sleeping with u and all the hallways creek and crack when u walk, it must be a pretty old building.
reviews.title: not satisfied

reviews.text: The place is nice and clean. The staff is very co-operative and helpful.Rooms are very nicely cleaned, love the pool area, good breakfast.... I would certainly give a 5 star to this hotel and would love to come back... never seen the rooms like this.........overall, it's a good choice......
reviews.title: BEST PLACE.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long day of driving we were torn between the Ramada and the Best Western, seeing as we had had a few bad times at a best western we thought we would try out the Ramada... walking in everything seemed ok ... the front desk girl was very helpful; but as we walked towards our room we starting to wonder... the side entrance had no lock on it (anyone from outside could ome in.... the floors were slanted in many places... when we walked in the room smelt very musty smell. The room had a great big king size bed which looked great, until u lay in it... it was totally curved into the middle if you sleep near the edge i will be on a complete slant. If that isn't enough in the morning i went to dry my hair and the hair dryer is mounted to the wall but the cord does not reach the plug in...
reviews.title: Horrible sleep.... stay somewhere else
